DOC.HEAD: F-16s on Training Flight Crash; Pilot Reported Killed
DOC.TEXT: Two U.S. Air Force fighter jets collided Monday during a training flight, and one of the F-16s crashed near a vegetable market in Ludwigshafen, officials said. Police said one pilot was killed. There were no injuries reported on the ground after the crash of the two F-16s, the first about 60 miles southwest of Frankfurt and the second outside Bobenheim-Roxheim. Hesse state radio said 12 people were in the market at the time of the 4:20 p.m. crash. Spokesman Doug Moore said from the U.S. Air Force headquarters in Ramstein that one pilot was taken to a U.S. Army hospital and that his condition was not known. Moore said the fate of the pilot of the second aircraft had not been determined. However, local police said in a statement that the second pilot was killed. No names were released. The pilots were the only crewmembers in the planes. ``Initial reports are that there were no injuries or casualties on the ground,'' Moore said.
